Sentencas: In this paper analysis results for a 2D solid oxide fuel cell model are presented.
Titulo: Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Design Optimization With Numerical Adjoint Techniques

Sentencas: The model is solved on an unstructured mesh with the finite-volume scheme using an iterative Newton's method.
Titulo: Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Design Optimization With Numerical Adjoint Techniques

Sentencas: A cost function is computed on the anode/electrolyte interface proportional to the ratio of the density of hydrogen to water.
Titulo: Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Design Optimization With Numerical Adjoint Techniques

Sentencas: Sensitivity derivatives of the cost function are obtained with respect to the design variable, Psi, the ratio of porosity to tortuosity in the mean transport pore model with three methods: finite-difference, direct differentiation, and the adjoint technique.
Titulo: Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Design Optimization With Numerical Adjoint Techniques

Sentencas: The results of the three methods are compared for accuracy.
Titulo: Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Design Optimization With Numerical Adjoint Techniques

Sentencas: An optimization step is taken using the sensitivity derivative to improve the value of the cost function.
Titulo: Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Design Optimization With Numerical Adjoint Techniques

Sentencas: The cost function is improved with the design step.
Titulo: Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Design Optimization With Numerical Adjoint Techniques
